page.title: 07Local Wildlife
page.content: The most common birds are thrushes, starlings,blackbirds,sparrows,finches, blue-tits,robins and tree creepers.In winter we sometimes see gulls. The most common insects are flies, spiders,woodlice,ants,hoverfly,wasps, greenfly,wasps,bees,earwigs and froghoppers.Butterflies are not as common as they used to be but you can see plenty of Cabbage Whites.Small Tortoishells,Red Admirals and Peacock butterflies can also be seen in this area. Larger animals often spotted include bats,hedgehogs(although lots get killed by cars),foxes,frogs and toads, shrews and mice.Local farmers complain about the rabbits and we have sometimes seen a hare running across our school playingfield.In the few wooded areas you can occasionally see a deer.
